H0.text: What product invented by Frederick Walton in 1864 became so widely used and 'stepped on' that the name became generic just 14 years after its invention. Asphalt

H1.text: What product invented by Frederick Walton in 1864 became so widely used and 'stepped on' that the name became generic just 14 years after its invention. Cork Tile

H2.text: What product invented by Frederick Walton in 1864 became so widely used and 'stepped on' that the name became generic just 14 years after its invention. Rubber Flooring

H3.text: What product invented by Frederick Walton in 1864 became so widely used and 'stepped on' that the name became generic just 14 years after its invention. Lynolium

A5.text: He experimented with the oxidised oil as a replacement for rubber.
